intro: Becium bequaertii, commonly known as the Malagasy becium, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the island's tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of particular interest to botanists and conservationists.
